triples.name: Generative artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper examines how generative AI tools can be applied to improve social science research methodologies.

triples.name: Survey methodology
triples.relevance: The paper discusses how generative AI can improve survey research, a core social science methodology.

triples.name: Randomized controlled trial
triples.relevance: The paper mentions online experiments as a technique that can benefit from generative AI applications.

triples.name: Content analysis
triples.relevance: The paper discusses automated content analysis as a technique that can be enhanced by generative AI.

triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: The paper identifies agent-based models as a social science technique that can benefit from generative AI improvements.

triples.name: Bias (statistics)
triples.relevance: The paper examines how bias in training data negatively impacts generative AI and social science research quality.

triples.name: Open-source software
triples.relevance: The paper proposes creating open-source infrastructure for research on human behavior to address AI limitations and ensure access.
